definitions.definition: To put under the care and supervision of a master , for the purpose of instruction in a trade or business .
examples: His father had apprenticed him to a silk merchant.
He was apprenticed to a local employer.
Joe apprenticed three different photographers before setting up his own studio.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To put under the care and supervision of a master , for the purpose of instruction in a trade or business .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To be an apprentice to.
